main event: A witness reported a sighting of a celestial body in Berlin, Germany, on 21 December 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as roundish and about 8-10 meters in diameter with a flaring red tail., The observation lasted only 2 seconds and was made from approximately 1 mile away., The object emitted a brilliant white light and made no noise during the sighting., The witness filed a report with local authorities after the sighting., The initial military analysis suggested it was probably a meteor.
sighted object: a celestial body with a bright white light and a red tail
witness description: a psychotherapist who reported the sighting to local authorities
